description: Senior Software Engineer â€¢ Software Engineer

details.text: Organized and led frontend guild meetings to educate engineers and facilitate in-depth discussions on frontend topics within the context of our apps.

Directed the transition of our frontend from Travis CI to GitHub Actions and from Cypress end-to-end tests to Playwright, cutting our CI/CD build time by nearly 75% and enabling more reliable test coverage.
Integrated Cursor AI into the development workflow, significantly accelerating development and reducing turnaround time for story completion by ~30%.
Led a 5-engineer team across multiple sprints, coordinating story assignment, writing build plans, and maintaining continuous communication with Product to align deliverables with business goals.

children.text: Mentored and managed associate engineers, providing technical guidance and career development support.

details.text: Developed software components in an Agile/Scrum environment, ensuring system reliability for critical defense applications.

children.text: Served as subject matter expert for a major system software component, providing guidance and technical ownership within the team.

details.text: Designed and built a terminal testing utility with Python, Tkinter, and Pytest, improving satellite system security and reliability.
Collaborated across multiple teams and technologies, adapting quickly to new environments and contributing to diverse projects, from lab testing utilities to field satellite system development.
Ensured reliability of military software systems supporting sensitive national security initiatives, through ongoing maintenance, testing, and validation.
Wrote T-SQL scripts to manage large datasets, improving reporting efficiency and reducing manual analysis.
Assisted engineers in migrating data replication processes from Informatica to SLT, ensuring smoother enterprise operations.
Collaborated with other interns to design and launch a Confluence splash page for the MatrixOne factory tool, improving usability for 500+ end users.
Adapted quickly to enterprise tools and workflows, contributing meaningfully to projects within the short internship timeframe.

description: Section Manager, Wiki Administrator, Beta Tester

details.text: Designed and customized forum and Wiki themes using HTML, CSS, and JavaScript, building a strong foundation in front-end development.
Administered five Wiki sub-domains, building unique CSS themes and templates using MediaWiki syntax.

children.text: Contributed 700,000+ bytes of original content across these five Wikis.

details.text: Moderated and managed a group of 300+ forums, providing leadership, enforcing community standards, and mentoring contributors.
Reviewed and approved 2,000+ user content submissions, ensuring content quality and consistency across platforms, while contributing 10,000+ of my own.
Tested and validated site features before release, reporting issues and suggesting improvements, gaining early experience in quality assurance and user-focused development.
